meanings.definition: A person or thing that discriminates between different things or people.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used discriminators to choose the best student for the award.
meanings.sent2: The security guard's job is to be a discriminator and only allow authorized personnel inside.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted as a discriminator, only letting the friendly visitors pet her.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl was a discriminator of truth, always able to see through lies.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's superpower was to be a discriminator of good and evil, always knowing the right path to take.

meanings.definition: A device or component that distinguishes between signals or data.
meanings.sent1: The radar system has discriminators to filter out unwanted signals.
meanings.sent2: The barcode scanner acts as a discriminator to read product information.
meanings.sent3: The robot's discriminator malfunctioned, causing it to mix up all the data.
meanings.sent4: The metal detector at the airport is a discriminator, ensuring no prohibited items pass through.
meanings.sent5: The computer's discriminator was top-notch, accurately sorting through the vast amount of information.

meanings.definition: A gene or protein that determines a specific trait or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The geneticist studied the discriminators responsible for eye color.
meanings.sent2: The DNA test revealed the presence of specific discriminators linked to the disease.
meanings.sent3: The mutant gene acted as a discriminator, giving the superhero special powers.
meanings.sent4: The protein's role as a discriminator was crucial in identifying the genetic disorder.
meanings.sent5: The plant's DNA contained discriminators that made it resistant to pests.
